message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest the patient is experiencing malignant hyperthermia. Dantrolene is the drug of choice and should be administered immediately. Cyproheptadine can also be used in addition to dantrolene, but dantrolene should be given first. Labetalol and Lorazepam are not appropriate in this situation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest malignant hyperthermia, which is a rare but potentially fatal complication of general anesthesia. The high potassium levels and metabolic acidosis are also consistent with this diagnosis. Dantrolene is the specific treatment for malignant hyperthermia. Cyproheptadine is used as an alternative but less effective treatment, while Labetalol and Lorazepam are unlikely to be helpful in this scenario.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is exhibiting symptoms of malignant hyperthermia, a rare but potentially fatal reaction to general anesthesia. The high fever, muscle rigidity, and metabolic acidosis are all consistent with this diagnosis. Among the options, dantrolene is the most appropriate next step in pharmacotherapy for treating malignant hyperthermia. It works by inhibiting calcium release from the sarcoplasmic reticulum which helps to relieve the muscle rigidity and hyperthermia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is experiencing malignant hyperthermia, a potentially fatal reaction to certain anesthetics. Dantrolene is the drug of choice for the treatment of malignant hyperthermia. It works by preventing the release of calcium ions from the sarcoplasmic reticulum of skeletal muscle, thus stopping the contraction of skeletal muscles.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is exhibiting symptoms of malignant hyperthermia (MH), which is a serious and potentially fatal reaction to general anesthesia. The elevated temperature, muscle rigidity, and metabolic and respiratory acidosis are all signs of MH. The most appropriate next step in pharmacotherapy is administration of dantrolene, which is the only drug known to be effective in treating MH. Cyproheptadine is sometimes used as an adjunct therapy, but dantrolene is the first-line treatment. Labetalol and lorazepam are not indicated for the treatment of MH.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is experiencing malignant hyperthermia, which is a rare but life-threatening complication of general anesthesia. The most appropriate next step in pharmacotherapy is dantrolene, which is used to prevent and treat malignant hyperthermia. Cyproheptadine is an alternative treatment, but it is not the first-line treatment for this condition. Labetalol and lorazepam are not appropriate for the treatment of malignant hyperthermia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, including muscle rigidity, fever, and altered mental status, suggest malignant hyperthermia. The laboratory studies show metabolic and respiratory acidosis, and elevated potassium levels, which are consistent with malignant hyperthermia. Dantrolene is the treatment of choice for malignant hyperthermia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, including fever, muscle rigidity, tachycardia, and high potassium levels, suggest malignant hyperthermia (MH). Dantrolene is the drug of choice for treating MH. Cyproheptadine is also used for treating MH, but it is not the first-line treatment. Labetalol and lorazepam are not effective treatments for MH.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest malignant hyperthermia, which is an uncommon but potentially fatal complication of general anesthesia. The laboratory results show metabolic acidosis and hyperkalemia, which are consistent with the diagnosis. The most appropriate next step in pharmacotherapy is dantrolene, which is a skeletal muscle relaxant used to treat malignant hyperthermia. The other options are not indicated for this condition.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, including fever, masseter muscle rigidity, and lockjaw, suggest malignant hyperthermia. The increased potassium levels is also a characteristic finding. Dantrolene is the treatment of choice for malignant hyperthermia.
